SimesThresholdFamily

SimesThresholdFamily.Rd

Simes' threshold family

SimesThresholdFamily(m, kMax = m)

Arguments

m

The number of hypotheses tested
kMax

For simultaneous control of (\(k\)-FWER for all \(k \le k[max]\)).

Value

A threshold function (on the scale of test statistics) based on the classical family of thresholds introduced by Simes (1986): \(\alpha*k/m\). This family yields joint FWER control at level (at most) \(\alpha\) if the test statistics are positively dependent (PRDS) under H0.

Author

Gilles Blanchard, Pierre Neuvial and Etienne Roquain

Examples


sk <- SimesThresholdFamily(12)
thr <- sk(0.2)

Contents

Developed by Gilles Blanchard, Guillermo Durand, Pierre Neuvial, Etienne Roquain.
